intro: Crassula sarcocaulis subsp. sarcocaulis, commonly known as the stone rose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit and fleshy, gray-green leaves that form a rosette. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple during the spring. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil and minimal water. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
